website_summaries.verdict: High-quality camera track stabilization system that can support even large cameras nicely.
pros: Stabilizer rail system can support camera equipment up to 17.5 pounds with a 31.5-inch length of rail
Slider includes multiple ball bearings to ensure a smooth operation with no wobble that could ruin your video shot
Can tilt the slider at different angles to shoot special effect videos and photos
cons: Claims to connect easily to a tripod, but you'll probably notice wobbling in this case

customer_reviews.title: This is why it was great. Great company
customer_reviews.text: Just got it out of the box and few minutes ago. Looooove it. Dolly tracks are what I've been dying to have for years. But they were expensive. This is why it was great. Great company. Great price. Only thing I was a little, eh, on was one of the rubber mounts was missing and two looked like it was coated in sand. I looked in the pouch and found a bag with 4 more rubbers so no complaints. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Josh Little

customer_reviews.title: Consider the shorter length option
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really well-built and easy to use. If I could do it again, I'd pick the shorter length. 30"+ is a lot of travel and I rarely used 75% of the length while shooting. Even though the longer length wasn't much more expensive, it left me with the following challenges: - Harder to transport - Less room in tight spaces - Harder to keep the rails out of the camera's field of view for shorter zoom-in pans
customer_reviews.author: Jordan T

customer_reviews.title: Quality slider
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth and light. Replacing an older smaller manual slider than developed flat spots in the roller (probably from sitting in a hot car tightened down). Right away this performed well with my GH5/Speedbooster/Sigma 18-35 setup. the 31" is was the right choice as it's much easier to actually work with and I can get away with mounting it to a single tripod. I was tempted to buy the longer model, but glad I didn't as this gives me the looks I'm after. Used a knock-off quick connect plate on the tripod and can easily remove it when not needed and it's still rigid enough with only a little dip on the end isn't bad for my rig.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Unbeleivable Slider for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Neewer may not be the highest quality kit, but they know how to put quality and value into lesser-priced equipment. It's light (CF, after all), sturdy smooth and quiet. Comes with 1/4-20 to 3/8 threads adapter and a couple of extra rubber feet. The *only* negative I could find is that the slider binds just a tad near the center, where the metal brace is attached, but not enough to make much difference. Add a video head to this and your shots just got 500% more creative.
customer_reviews.author: filmyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It so big!
customer_reviews.text: So this is the first slider I've purchased and my thought was, well bigger is better. This thing is absolutely HUGE! So big that it absolutely requires two tripods to get even the slightest use out of it unless you're only 2 inches off the ground with the legs that it comes with. Because of he design of the fluid head that I use with it, I had to buy a spacer to go below the fluid head, above the mount on the slider. I couldn't tighten down the nut otherwise. Its okay for what it is and pretty great for the price. But we all know that when buying Neewer, we're getting what we pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Guise

customer_reviews.title: solid just solid
customer_reviews.text: super solid manual slider, i also bought the z-mount which will enable to elevate/tilt/or 90 degree your dslr. it comes with hex key if you need to tighten anything (i didn’t have to). all the legs and hand tightening bolts are solid...for $69 this slider is smooth, the 6 bearings makes it a smooth slide along the carbon fiber rails, not sure if it’s real carbon fiber but oh well, use it for side to side dollies or front to back pushes and pulls, this slider works great.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Casem Jr

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing slider quality but...
customer_reviews.text: This slider is a must have for people wanting to work with videography and can't afford a motorized one yet. I got the largest one here and the carbon fiber is awesome, solid and light weight. Every little thing worked great. Only flaw I had why it didn't get 5 stars is the length becomes a con. It doesn't break down at all so it's awkward to carry around. I gave up on it.and sold it to a friend because I didn't want to deal with it. Bought a gimbal instead.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Caradonna

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: This is my first camera slider, so I don't have anything to compare it to. Nonetheless, this Neewer model appears to be a decent value for the money. Travel is nice and smooth up and down the track. Construction is solid, durable. I purchased the smallest 60cm track, and it offers more than enough length to film with. Can't imagine why I'd need a track longer than this. Mounted my Manfrotto fluid head on top and the action is nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: ToddDominey

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: I just used this one on a shoot with my BMPCC 4K and I'm surprised at how silky smooth the action is. Usually around this price point, the sled will not have consistent friction across the rails, causing the slide to speed up and slow down awkwardly. This one took my camera and accessories like a champ! I will say on the 47" slider, you'll want to support the ends as well as the middle. I used lighting stands with the screw holes at the ends.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is an incredible little slider. As long as you don't try to push the maximum capacity, you can get amazing results attaching both ends to cheap tripods. The fact that there's no assembly required and it includes a nice little bag is great. I paired this with Pergear Tripod Ball Head and the Rock Steady SS Stainless Steel 1/4" to 3/8" Bushing Adapter, and I was good to mount an A7 iii on top with some pretty great results.
customer_reviews.author: GrifftheQuinn

customer_reviews.title: Great slider, poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: The slider is well made and moves smoothly on the rails. The packaging for delivery was inadequate for the job. The slider lock was not set allowing it to get entangled with the velcro straps and ripping one of the straps anchoring stitching, rendering it unreliable for securing the rails in the bag. The foam protective disc was not secured to the slider allowing the mounting stud to tear through the bag and padding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Slider
customer_reviews.text: GREAT slider I don't know how anyone could give this anything but a 5 Star rating it is made very well it is very smooth , I have used it many times now and it is great, for the money it must be the best one out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not for professional work
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: After using this slider multiple times in the field, it can not handle the capacity advertised when adapter on a tripod. I would only use this for bare-bones DSLR/Mirrorless work. Also, if you can get a completely smooth shot out of this thing, then head to Hollywood -- you're a top-tier camera operator.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Best slider ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional slider Am using this product for filming smooth dolly shots it does the job very well , the build quality is awesome and steady
customer_reviews.author: SUBILANGA K.

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and Undependable
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. The adjustable feet never line up so when you are sliding it bobs up and down, the slider bumbles over every fiber in the carbon fiber mesh, and when using it in a tripod, the carbon rods like to warp causing the footage to slack downward. Unless you want to use Warp Stabilization in post-production every-time, just invest in a better aluminum one or better.
customer_reviews.author: Trill Shatner

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed. :)
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed. It looks, feels, and performs like something many times more expensive. It's very solid, very well made, excellent fit and finish, no flexing, and moves like silk, using both my DSLR with 70-300mm lens and my camcorder. It looks great as well. It looks like I spent many hundreds on it. Very nice. I'd highly recommend. :)
customer_reviews.author: David A. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Slide into some great shots!
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely amazing when you need beautifully smooth slides and you're on a budget this slider is the best. The only criticism I have and this goes for people not too familiar with the sturdiness of camera slides, not the camera slide itself, is buy a tripod with a fluid head or a fluid head for your existing tripod. I don't know what I was thinking putting it on a ball head tripod. It wobbled like it was deliberately defying me. That being said, great slide the bigger one I bought here is going to be a part of my filmmaking arsenal for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jose de Jesus Gomez

customer_reviews.title: NOT ON A TRIPOD
customer_reviews.text: On a table, great! - On a tripod, forget it... it bends and your video will be borderline useless.
customer_reviews.author: GlassnGuns

customer_reviews.title: Not smooth because...
customer_reviews.text: Slider arrived.. Opened it it was discolored and the carbon had scratches that affected the smoothness of the slider.. This was my second one with similar issue..
customer_reviews.author: Rez jr

customer_reviews.title: Very good. No friction control.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Sturdy and lightweight. Most importantly, fluid. VERY fluid. TOO fluid sometimes. It's overall great, the one thing I don't like is the lack of a friction controll. Basically you have 2 options: Moving and not moving. Still, works great with a sturdy tripod and fluid head. Lots of fun so far. I might try to add a homemade small motor to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Slider. Not for heavy cameras
customer_reviews.text: This slider looks professional. It's a smooth as silk! I love it. I put a tripod head on it and use my full size JVC-GY-HM850U (10-11LBS). I use heavy duty stands on both ends and the middle for a rock solid shot. If you shoot with DSLR'S, those light weight cameras won't know what hit them. You will get smooth, steady sliding shots any way you choose to use this outstanding piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony's Papa

customer_reviews.title: You got to practice sliding
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product once you get some practice. I was gonna give up and bought the electric one. But finally I got better sliding it manually. Don’t have to spend extra now.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Nice slider - very smooth and very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This slider is very well made and is extremely smooth. It's also very light when it doesn't have a camera attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob CTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Got this as my first slider and I was very ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my first slider and I was very impressed at how solid it is. Time will tell how it holds up but so far I'm quite impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I thought 31.5 noches was gonna be to small but I was wrong
customer_reviews.text: This is another tool that you should add to your production kit. I highly recommend. It provides both smooth motion and minimum abrasion For minimum noise. Must Have
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this to anyone who is selective about performance.
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth movement. Very stable platform for photography or videography. I have purchased two other sliders in the past two years. This one performs like I hoped the others would.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for room to improve. Great slider just a bit time consuming to set up and make sure it’s leveled out properly for panning.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly-needs to be placed on a sturdy surface obviously-very smooth and quiet-excellent value-comes with a nice padded carry case and several cables. Even contains an extra belt! couldn't be happier with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: It works very well - very smooth, easy to setup. Bag is terrible though - zipper broke immediately, first time I pulled on it. But still good value.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nuttmann

customer_reviews.title: Decent for a beginner slider
customer_reviews.text: The main problem with is that the structure 'flexes' as you slide the DSLR down the rail, causing the footage to distort in its axis so you have to be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: adrigil

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good slider. I recommend you use it with 2 tripods to maintain the balance for larger cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lowry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality
customer_reviews.text: At first I bought a slider from a pro camera store for twice the price, but I couldn't use it because it would jump and get stuck. This slider works like a dream; the parts are durable and high-grade, yet still light enough to conveniently stick in a backpack. For an entry-level slider, you cannot do better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bajgrowicz

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: A really cool track slider. The carbon fiber not only has a really cool look to it, it makes for a much lighter camera slider that still has a very sturdy build. It comes with some very stable adjustable legs to help make shooting a bit easier. The ball bearings make for silky smooth movement. You can also attach this to your tripod. I like this brand pretty much. They always brings a high quality product to the market that is hundreds of dollars less expensive than others available.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Unstable headache
customer_reviews.text: You'll spend a ton of time setting this set up to be sturdy and level only to find that the tracks leave your footage shaky and choppy. I've tried numerous ways to try to make this work on shoots but have given up on getting it to create smooth rolling footage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Szczepanski

customer_reviews.title: great slider for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This slider is excellent for the price. Its overall a great slider. pretty smooth (not silky smooth but probably good for most shots the average shooter needs) . Highly recommeneded!
customer_reviews.author: Austin P.Top Contributor: Drums

customer_reviews.title: GOOD AT WHAT YOU EXPECT IT TO DO
customer_reviews.text: Overall does it's job, rolls smooth and quiet. My only issue is attaching my camera can be difficult and quirky.
customer_reviews.author: Parris W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight, handles weight well
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile, lightweight, easy to use slider. It can handle the capacity as advertised. Build quality is amazing and it does make for some wonderful images/footages. One thing however, is that you might just find yourself needing more than one tripod if you’re planning on ripping the full benefits of those 31.5 inches. This does seem a bit inconvenient when traveling. Plan ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Habakkuk

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This track slider is perfect for shooting with my panasonic. It allows me to move my camera myself at my own speed but on a balanced railing system, very brilliantly made. Intermediate single and duo tripod mounting. Threaded column bottom base and rail siding thread holes for multiple track mounts. The six bearing wheels gives me smooth movement underneath the base. 1/4 and 3/8 holes for multiple camera or bracket thread sizing. Great for slow motion closeups and following nature footage.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Breton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this so far. Super smooth and long for that extra sliding range. Very happy with this sliding rail.
customer_reviews.author: K-Trek

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The slider works great and is easily assembled/adjustable. I did notice, however, that there are a few rough spots on the rods that create extra friction when sliding the camera. I'm sure there must be some way to alleviate this. For now, I would just recommend lots of practice.
customer_reviews.author: Yev Zakharov

customer_reviews.title: Where the thumb screw?
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've only done some test shots but one glaring problem I see is that the screw to attach your camera does not turn from underneath. You have to TURN you camera to attach it! Meaning, if you want it to face a certain way by the time it's tight, you gotta figure out what position to start it in....SMH. I didn't expect the world for this price but I expected more than that. Otherwise, seems smooth and solid on the build.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It’s not great, but it’s not the worst. If you’re looking for buttery smooth movement on the track, save your money. If you loosen the knob all the way, it moves smoothly but then it’s on you to be slow and steady. Didn’t come with 3/8 attachment which was frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: silky smooth perfection
customer_reviews.text: silky smooth perfection. I like the carbon fiber bars - carbon fiber should break before it bends
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gingerich

customer_reviews.title: Anyone interested in pulling some tough Establishing shots and is an amateur in film would LOVE this product
customer_reviews.text: Smooth as silk. I was really impressed by how well built this little slider is. It comes ready to go and the 6 ball bearings create for very steady and smooth movement. Anyone interested in pulling some tough Establishing shots and is an amateur in film would LOVE this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Popolizio

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little time to study and conclude that it is perfect for beginners and intermediate video production. I tried to record some videos with it, which is very suitable for slomo. So it will never waste your money and time. With some exercises, you can still use it to get great camera slider shots.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Great for my go pro
customer_reviews.text: Could not beat it for the price. I had a few diy sliders to save money but they weren't as smooth and durable as this slider
customer_reviews.author: Hemi_ram808

customer_reviews.title: Great slider for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I was initially worried about the quality of this slider given the cheaper price, but so far I am thoroughly happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Roman Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Cinematic slider
customer_reviews.text: This is a great slider for anyone trying to get that cinematic look for their films or videos. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Luckarphotography

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, strong and smooth. I always use two tripods with manual or motorized sliders. Otherwise you might get tilting when sliding off to either side.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice slider!
customer_reviews.text: I am really amazed with the quality of this slider, especially for the price... Nice design, lightweight, looks great, legs are nice, and rolls really nice and smooth! No binding anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Frazee

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: SO happy with this slider, it looks great, is light and easy to carry and is ridiculously smooth. I think you would have to be making some serious mistakes to mess up any footage with this thing. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this. It’s smooth it’s accurate right on the money thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Channa Shelden

customer_reviews.title: Overall really good!
customer_reviews.text: Only part I don't like is that there doesn't seem to be a way to add rails to extend it longer. You cannot connect these 15mm rods with another 15mm via a 15mm rod connector, because the Neewer 15mm rod has a 1/4" male head at the end of it. Slides pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Cousteau Christopher

customer_reviews.title: It's so nice.
customer_reviews.text: the fluidity with this slider is so nice. being able to move my frame side to side has brought life to my clips, the movement stays balanced on the flat railing. can move as slightly or as quickly as I want since I control the speed. it's quiet too so you don't to worry about any noise interruption.
customer_reviews.author: Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Carbon fiber looks great and it's lightweight. It's easy to use and will add another level to your video.
customer_reviews.author: y2says

customer_reviews.title: Stable and smooth.
customer_reviews.text: I am a newbie, but this device gives my video a professional feel. Stability is its basic performance, and it is worth mentioning that its roller/ball is very quiet. In short, the video made with it requires almost no post-editing. I like its foldable legs and it's more portable.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed but
customer_reviews.text: Looks great well constructed but the screw that holds in place is tight or way to lose. Can not be used to get moving time lapse easily.
customer_reviews.author: Martin M.

customer_reviews.title: A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Due to Amazon's return policy, I am not worried about buying cheap fakes, but this time is a happy and satisfying attempt. The construction quality of this slide is very good, the dolly will not shake on the track, just slide smoothly to the left or right.
customer_reviews.author: Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Its not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if i received it as is or its meant to be bent
customer_reviews.author: EMS VISUALS

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality piece of equipment. Smooth.
customer_reviews.text: The slider came packed nicely and set up super easy. Smooth as silk right out of the box. Note that you can adjust tension on the carriage with the bottom hex bolts. A little fine tuning there to your liking. Nice piece of equipment. Pro quality.
customer_reviews.author: Racer ID Media

customer_reviews.title: This slider nails it!
customer_reviews.text: This slider nails it! The 6 bearings on it give it a lot to hold with. Carbon fiber so it's light and the legs are adjustable. This slider has all the features I want, it goes smooth, slow or as fast as I want, and I can travel with it with the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Adams Moore

customer_reviews.title: A complete Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: So flimsy that I threw it in the closet and never use it. A complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this slider, it allows me to move with my shot and gets smooth results when the actors are moving and talking. I can go at the same pace and still keep my camera balanced. The size is just right and the quality is great, worth every penny it cost. Great for budget filmmakers.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Baez

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be more pleased
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this slider since April and couldn't be more pleased with the performance of it. These guys did a great job making this!
customer_reviews.author: Drake Phillips

customer_reviews.title: OMG!!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! The quality of the building is absolutely excellent and the price is beyond fairness. The all-metal legs with rubber feet are adjustable for use when they need to be placed on a table or floor. This is a great purchase I have made and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it🙌
customer_reviews.text: I like the build quality with this price. I believe you guys can do better with the bag quality. Other than that I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ade Man

customer_reviews.title: Added stability
customer_reviews.text: Pretty legit manual slider. Good bit of versatility with how you can use it. This one allows you to use a tripod on both ends for added stability!
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super smooth!... you can't beat it for the money! Excellent build quality!
customer_reviews.author: aaronh

customer_reviews.title: very good slider
customer_reviews.text: made from good material. very strong. rail slider is almost 4 foot long which is perfect length. everything works good on this already.
customer_reviews.author: Peddy

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to take it out again.
customer_reviews.text: This rail seems to be very light, especially for its length. In the first few outdoor photography, it was a highlight. Can't wait to take it out again.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and travels well
customer_reviews.text: Smooth. Sturdy. Plenty of flexibility to adapt and add to the main plate. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rail, can't say enough for it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rail, can't say enough for it! I am likely to buy my second rail in the near future, no doubt I will still choose the Neewer product.
customer_reviews.author: Pope Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Light wieght and durable with standard care.
customer_reviews.text: this unit works great,I use the canon xf300 on it two tripods and a little practice and look out Spielberg.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful inexpensive rail!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful inexpensive rail, just like acting on ice, but never fall!
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: waste of time, 0 safety
customer_reviews.text: was just doing my first test and the screw falls off. don't buy it, so glad i didnt put my c100 on it
customer_reviews.author: YasserNabil

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth
customer_reviews.text: Owned for about a month now. Very smooth motion and it is lightweight for easy portability. Used it in a wedding recently, would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Jericho

customer_reviews.title: Could cost 3x as much.
customer_reviews.text: Almost too good to be true for the price. I've seen similar in person at B&H for 300 bucks. I will have to put it through the paces, but everything looks and feels good. All metal, even the legs, with carbon track. Super smooth and nearly silent, the bearings feel buttery. Will update after using for a gig.
customer_reviews.author: Mel O

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good so far, used on on 3 projects now. - Bag is not the best though.
customer_reviews.author: Vlak Vark Productions

customer_reviews.title: friction knob not functional. feet hard to set and too short. otherwise good quality.
customer_reviews.text: The feet are difficult to set level and are too short !` otherwise the construction quality is pleasing. One point that may be a no go for some buyers is : The friction knob is bad, and the amount of friction is not even at the extremities and the center of the rail. (basically, it is not functional) see it more as an ON/OFF break than a way slow the motion, because the motion will randomly get stopped half-way if you use the knob.
customer_reviews.author: F.corlierTop Contributor: Photography

product_meta.title: Neewer 31.5 inches/80 centimeters Carbon Fiber Camera Track Slider Video Stabilizer Rail with 6 Bearings for DSLR Camera DV Video Camcorder Film Photography, Load up to 17.5 pounds/8 kilograms
product_meta.description:
Size:80cm

Note: Camera, tripod and ball head are NOT included. 

Description: 

The Carbon Fiber Camera Track Slider Rail helps you with smooth movements and professional feeling in video making and photography. 

We upgrade the product with U-shaped ball bearings under the slider part to ensure both smooth motion and minimum abrasion on high-grade carbon fiber tubes, to achieve stability and quietness when used to filming. 

6 U-shaped ball bearings under the slider part to ensure both smooth motion and minimum abrasion on high-grade carbon fiber tubes. 

2 threaded holes at each end of the track to mount tripod for vertical shooting. 

5 threaded holes in fixed plate to mount tripod for horizontal and even 45-degree shooting. 

4 threaded holes in slider plate to mount other accessories such as magic arms to enrich your photo quality. 

Foldable legs for less a burden, easier portability and quicker set up time. 

Leg position is adjustable in large scale for demanding filming task. 

Gear-shaped joint interface and locking knobs for better position locking. 

Height of legs could be adjusted from 8.5cm to 10cm. 

Universal slider plate with a 1/4"" threaded hole to hold most DSLR cameras. (Even comes with a 1/4"" to 3/8"" screw) 

Locking knob aside to lock down the slider plate. 

Partly hollowed out for more scientific way to load. 

Round rubber pad to avoid scratches to your camera's bottom. 

A bubble level to indicate your slanting degree. 

Comes with a convenient carrying bag, easy and carry, transport and store. 

Specifications: 

Color: Gold 

Material: Carbon Fiber 

Length of Track: 31.5 inches/80 centimeters 

Maximum Leg Height: 3.9 inches/10 centimeters 

Minimum Leg Height: 3.3 inches/8.5 centimeters 

Load Capacity: 17.5 pounds/8 kilograms 

Package Contents: 

1 x 80cm Carbon Fiber Track Slider Rail 

1 x Carrying Bag
feature_bullets: 6 U-shaped Ball Bearings: U-shaped ball bearings under the slider part to ensure both smooth motion and minimum abrasion on high-grade carbon fiber tubes
Flexible Uses: The track can be used on the ground or worked with tripod. It can be directly connected with camera, or indirectly connected with camera via ball head
ulti-Angle Shooting: Available for vertical, horizontal and 45 degrees shooting by using the threaded holes in the slider
Adjustable and Secured Legs: Height of legs could be adjusted from 8.5 centimeters to 10 centimeters; Gear-shaped joint interface and locking knobs for better position locking for the legs
Convenient Carrying Bag: Easy and carry, transport and store; Excellent company for video making

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars563 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
